DataElement.preferredDefinition: the type or extent of extracapsular disease present.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the extracapsular disease being present.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Situated outside of a capsule, esp. outside the capsular ligament of a joint.:A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Situated outside of a capsule, esp. outside the capsular ligament of a joint.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: Present; the period of time that is happening now.

Concepts.definition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time._The smallest possible quantity._A benign or malignant pathologic structure in any part of the body, resulting from a neoplastic accumulation of cells._To increase in length or duration._A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status._The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object._A metric unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter (10E-3 meter) or approximately 0.03937 inch._The dense connective tissue that surrounds a lymph node.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time._Large in quantity, range, or spatial extent._A benign or malignant pathologic structure in any part of the body, resulting from a neoplastic accumulation of cells._To increase in length or duration._The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one._A metric unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter (10E-3 meter) or approximately 0.03937 inch._The dense connective tissue that surrounds a lymph node.

Concepts.definition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.
Large in quantity, range, or spatial extent.
A benign or malignant pathologic structure in any part of the body, resulting from a neoplastic accumulation of cells.
To increase in length or duration.
The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.

A metric unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter (10E-3 meter) or approximately 0.03937 inch.

Concepts.definition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.
Large in quantity, range, or spatial extent.
A benign or malignant pathologic structure in any part of the body, resulting from a neoplastic accumulation of cells.
To increase in length or duration.
A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one.
